text: Kevin S. McGrew is an American psychologist and intelligence researcher. He is the founder and director of the Institute for Applied Psychometrics, as well as a visiting professor of educational psychology at the University of Minnesota. He was formerly Professor of Applied Psychology at St. Cloud State University. He is a co-author of Batteries III and IV of the Woodcock–Johnson Tests of Cognitive Abilities. In 2016, he received the University of Minnesota College of Education and Human Development's Distinguished Alumni Award. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Living people Category:Intelligence researchers Category:Minnesota State University Moorhead alumni Category:University of Minnesota alumni Category:St. Cloud State University faculty Category:Psychometricians Category:Educational psychologists Category:American psychologists Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Kevin McGrew
